basics.name: Joubin Jabbari
basics.label: Secure Software Engineer
basics.summary: Providing information assurance and system integrity by understanding the entire development cycle. Full-stack software developer with more than 2 years industry experience specializing in secure and scalable software development focusing primarily on software architecture and design.

work.company: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
work.summary: The National Incident Response Team (NIRT) is an in-house Information Security team that serves the entire Federal Reserve System (FRS) across the United States and its territories. As a software security engineer in a rather new team within NIRT, I work on many different projects focusing on security and security activities during the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
highlights: Conduct code reviews during software security assessments
Focus on integrating secure software development during the SDLC
Assist and develop coursework for threat modeling class
Assist in a threat model of an application already in production
Author monthly newsletter focused on software security and relevant mitigation factors
Write scripts and applications for the automation of daily routines, predominantly those that involve large datasets

work.summary: Developed a data collection system that had two major requirements: realtime data acquisition and security. This was achieved using Java and Java RMI for the abstract non-realtime tasks and C for the realtime tasks on separate realtime systems. These two realms were then connected using a REST API.
highlights: Became a full stack developer by developing everything from an embedded system to a cross platform distributed web controlled system
Promoted to senior developer after 6 months
Created STIGed systems using DISA and NIST standards

work.summary: Researched and developed an algorithm (mostly in Python and C) for correlating websites and web applications for their author by analyzing html coding style, cookie data structures, and third-party api usage programmatically.
highlights: Assessed web applications across the web
Custom scripts written to automate web app analysis

volunteer.summary: Develop material to teach OWASP Top 10 from the perspective of the developer

volunteer.position: White Team Leader for National Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition
highlights: Used Nagios to judge the blue teams
Used Wireshark to analyze the game

courses: CSC 140 - Advanced Algorithm Design and Analysis

awards.title: Secure Software Programmer-Java (GSSP-JAVA)
awards.summary: Developing and designing code securely in Java: Analyst Number 1622

awards.title: HP Fortify Cert
awards.summary: Certification in HP Fortify and Software Security

awards.title: Third place ACM programming competition
awards.summary: ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest (abbreviated as ACM-ICPC or just ICPC) is an annual multi-tiered competitive programming competition among the universities of the world. The contest is sponsored by IBM.

awards.title: Security+ ce
awards.summary: Successfully completed CompTIA certification for work. Verification Code: 66QWMK5GKL4EKQ3N

publications.name: No Duplicates
publications.summary: A Chrome extension meant to minimize duplicate pages open to reduce unnecessary memory utilization

publications.name: Chance
publications.summary: First iOS application, written in Objective-C, as a means to test app development and publishing. This app was made in a span of one day in a programming competition.

publications.name: Save Santa
publications.summary: First iOS game, written in Swift 2.1, as a means to test game development and publishing. This game was made in a duration of 1 week.

publications.name: Apple, Google Collect User Data
publications.summary: Analyzed the top 100 apps on the Google Play Store as well as Apple's App Store to determine user privacy and security in comparison to each app's terms of service and privacy policy.

references.name: TC Niedzialkowski, Software Security Manager, Federal Reverse
Dr. Arad, Computer Science Professor, California State University
Ashkan Soltani, Chief Technologist, Federal Trade Commission
